data.description: Lab Summary: As part of Mobile Platform Services (MPS) within Samsung Research America, you will join the Advanced Research Team focused on cutting-edge computer vision, machine learning, and AI-driven XR (AR, MR, VR) technologies. Our mission is to build the next generation of head-mounted displays, spanning both commercial products and forward-looking research that will shape Samsung’s technology roadmap over the coming years. Position Summary: The Computer Vision & Machine Learning Intern will contribute to research and development of on-device image transformation, image denoising, image quality enhancement, and machine learning technologies across Samsung platforms. This role bridges research and product development, emphasizing the creation of innovative, efficient, and production-ready solutions for AR/VR systems. The position places particular emphasis on image transformation, denoising, and visual quality enhancement using computer vision and machine learning algorithms optimized for mobile and embedded devices. Position Responsibilities: Research and develop computer vision and machine learning algorithms for image transformation, denoising, and quality enhancement. Optimize and deploy GPU-accelerated ML pipelines on mobile and Android platforms. Prototype, evaluate, and refine algorithms for both research exploration and product integration. Collaborate closely with researchers and engineers to transition concepts into reliable, production-level solutions. Contribute to XR-related technologies including AR/VR imaging and perception pipelines. Required Skills: Currently pursuing a Master’s or PhD in Computer Vision, Machine Learning, or a related field. Hands-on experience with image denoising and image quality enhancement techniques. Experience with GPU processing on Android platforms. Strong understanding of deep learning algorithms, including model tuning and optimization using GPU libraries. Familiarity with key CV/ML areas such as: Image visual quality and readability enhancement Camera tracking and calibration Camera geometry and image transformation Machine learning modeling and optimization Solid foundation in software engineering principles and tools. Proficiency in C/C++ and at least one prototyping language such as Python. Strong collaboration, communication, self-motivation, and learning skills. Special Attributes: Experience with AR glasses, AR/VR headsets, or XR development platforms. Exposure to real-time or resource-constrained ML systems on mobile or embedded hardware. Our total rewards programs are designed to motivate and engage exceptional talent. The hourly pay rate range for roles at this level is listed below, but may be higher or lower in other states due to geographic differentials in the labor market. Within the hourly pay rate range, individual rates depend on a number of factors—including the role’s function and location as well as the individual’s knowledge, skills, experience, education and training. This is part of our comprehensive compensation package with annual bonus eligibility and generous benefits to help you live life well.Hourly Pay Rate Range$44 - $63 USDAdditional Information Disclosure of Trade Secrets Samsung has a strict policy on trade secrets. In applying to Samsung and progressing through the recruitment process, you must not disclose any trade secrets of a current or previous employer. Essential Job Functions This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, and frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.
